title: Last mile, hopefully.
body:
Some discussion on what is happening here can be found in #1409 and #1470 

TODO:

- [x] Various fixes by @yarikoptic 
- [x] `install` is a new-style generator command now
- [x] fixes #1469 
- [x] fixes #1173
- [x] fixes #1110
- [x] some work towards #875 
- [x] `install` no longer uses any low-level helpers directly, instead it sits rather cleanly on top of `clone` and `get`, and performs argument inspection and switching logic only. It seems that this is now at a stage where we could think about adding more convenience functionality to `install` without much pain (e.g. #1347, #1146)
- [x] code cleanup: unreachable parts in `install`, plus a duplicate (and buggy) implementation of a `clone` helper removed
- [x] Remove support for old-style "if_dirty" handling from `install` #1175
- [x] helpers unique to `get` now consolidated in `get.py`
- [x] Extend result filtering API to be able to pass a command's `kwargs`
- [x] Attempt to implement result filters for input argument based filtering in `install`
- [ ] Figure out what kind of result rendering we want #1476
- [ ] Possibly disable "implicit" result report for any command by default (at least via the cmdline API) -- this is more a thought than a plan for now and likely out of scope for this PR
- [x] must have fix for #1474
- [x] would be nice to get #1475 sorted out
- [x] make `get` report on things that annex is silent about (whole dirs, files in Git, ...)
